intro: Stanhopeastrum pullum, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a climbing plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by distinctive, fleshy, orange berries. Its botanical features include a smooth, often hairy stem and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
